info.title: Cart
info.description:
Provide APIs related to the shopping cart in a B2C store. Use these services to:
  • Get, add, update, or delete payment instructions
  • Get, add, update, or delete items in the shopping cart
  • Get the billing address
  • Calculate order prices
  • Lock or unlock the cart
  • Checkout
  • Get or update shipping information

externalDocs.description:
Some REST services require authentication. HCL Commerce REST services are authenticated on secure and unsecured channels. This authentication can include the use of the WCToken and WCTrustedToken. To use REST services that require authentication, you must first get authentication data by using a supported identity services.

After you obtain the authentication data, you must pass either the WCToken or WCTustedToken parameters, or both, within the HTTP header for every request that requires authentication. If a request is sent over HTTP, pass the WCToken parameter in the HTTP header. Do not pass the WCTrustedToken in HTTP requests, as the parameter value might display. Send both the WCToken and the WCTrustedToken parameters when the request is being sent over HTTPS.

The HCL Commerce REST APIs can also use session cookies that are created by the HCL Commerce store runtime for authentication. These cookies allow you to mix requests to the HCL Commerce REST APIs and the HCL Commerce store runtime within the same user session.

tags.name: Payment Instruction
tags.description: Provides RESTful services to get, add, update, or delete payment instructions.

tags.name: Cart
tags.description: Provides RESTful services to get, add, update, or delete items in the shopping cart, calculate order price, get the billing address, lock or unlock the cart, checkout, and many other things. It also provides services to get usable shipping and payment information by delegating to the Order BOD service.

tags.name: Shipping Info
tags.description: Provides RESTful services to get or update shipping information.

tags.name: Assigned Coupon
tags.description: Provides RESTful services to add, get, update, and delete assigned coupons for the current shopping cart.

tags.name: Assigned Promotion Code
tags.description: Provides RESTful services to add, get, update, and delete assigned promotion codes for the current shopping cart.

get.summary: Gets usable shipping information for the shopping cart by address.

parameters.name: storeId
parameters.description: The store identifier.

parameters.name: responseFormat
parameters.description: The response format. If the request has an input body, that body must also use the format specified in "responseFormat". Valid values include "json" and "xml" without the quotes. If the responseFormat isn't specified, the "accept" HTTP header shall be used to determine the format of the response. If the "accept" HTTP header isn't specified as well, the default response format shall be in json.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number, starting at 1. Valid values include positive integers of 1 and above. The "pageSize" must be specified for paging to work.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size. Used to limit the amount of data returned by a query. Valid values include positive integers of 1 and above. The "pageNumber" must be specified for paging to work.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The order ID.

400.description: Bad request. Some of the inputs provided to the request aren't valid.

401.description: Not authenticated. The user session isn't valid.

403.description: The user isn't authorized to perform the specified request.

404.description: The specified resource couldn't be found.

500.description: Internal server error. Additional details will be contained on the server logs.

parameters.name: responseFormat
parameters.description: The response format. Valid values are json and xml. If the request contains an input body, it must use the format specified in responseFormat. If the responseFormat is not specified, the accept  HTTP header determines the format of the response. If the accept  HTTP header is not specified then default response format is json.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number. Valid values are positive integers starting at 1. Use pageNumber with pageSize.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size. Used to limit the amount of data returned by a query. Valid values are integers starting with 1. Use pageSize with pageNumber.

parameters.name: langId
parameters.description: Language identifier. If not specified, the "locale" parameter is used. If "locale" is not specified, then the store default language is used.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The locale to use for example, locale=en_US. If the "langId" parameter is specified, the "locale" parameter is ignored. If no locale is specified, the store default locale is used.

parameters.name: sortOrderItemBy
parameters.description:
The sort order of the results for example, sort by orderItemID or createDate.
Available values:
  • orderItemID (x-introduced: 9.1.9.0)
  • createDate (x-introduced: 9.1.11.0)
  • quantity (x-introduced: 9.1.14.0)
  • inventoryStatus (x-introduced: 9.1.14.0)
  • price(x-introduced: 9.1.14.0)
  • unitPrice (x-introduced: 9.1.14.0)
  • partNumber (x-introduced: 9.1.14.0)

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The sort order of the requested field. ASC for ascending order and DESC for descending order. Default is ascending.

parameters.description: Profile name. Profiles determine the subset of data returned by a query.

UpdateOrderItemByOrderItemId.description: The `orderItemId` value returned in the response can be used as the `orderItemId` in requestBody of `PUT /store/{storeId}/cart/@self/update_order_item`.

storeId.description: The `storeId` value returned in the response can be used as the `storeId` parameter in `PUT /store/{storeId}/cart/@self/update_order_item`.

shipAsComplete.description: Option to ship the order as complete. Valid values include "true" and "false".

x_calculateOrder.description: Specifies whether OrderCalculateCmd will be called to calculate the charges for the order. 0 = do not call OrderCalculateCmd, 1 = call OrderCalculateCmd.

x_calculationUsage.description: The identifier for the type of calculation to be performed on the order.

x_inventoryValidation.description: Specifies whether inventory status should be validated for adding to cart.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.order.handler.Cart.description: Description of the addOrderItem input body.

catEntryId.description: The product ID of the item, use 'catEntryId' instead of 'productId' here.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.order.handler.Cart.description: Description of the addOrderItemWithPromotion input body.

calculationUsageId.description: Gives predefined codes for calculation of discounts (-1), shipping (-2), sales tax (-3), shipping tax (-4), coupons (-5), surcharge (-6) and shipping adjustment (-7).

doPrice.description: Specifies whether the command should perform the price calculation subtasks. Set to enable the price tasks (Y), or to disable price tasks (N).

updatePrices.description: Flag to indicate whether the price of order item is refreshed in this command. if the flag is "1", price is updated. others will not.

outOrderName.description: Specifies the names of name-value pairs to pass to a JSP file. The value of each added name-value pair is the reference number of the order to display. If the name is not provided, the default name orderId is used. This parameter can be repeated.

doFreeGift.description: Specifies whether the command should perform the free gift handling logic. Set to enable free gift handling, or not to handle free gifts when not required for order recalculation (N). The default value is (Y).

com.ibm.commerce.rest.order.handler.Cart.description: Body of request input for calculateOrder.

outOrderName.description: The reference number of a destination order.

orderId.description: The id of the order to which the reward option record is associated with.

rewardOptionId.description: The ID of the reward option record to update with reward choice information.

orderId.description: Specifies an order using the order reference number or one of the Order abbreviations. If the parameter is omitted, all the pending orders is set to current. If a specified pending order no longer exists, it is not set to current.

outOrderName.description: The reference number of a destination order.

fulfillmentCenterName.description: The name of the fulfillment center where the order item should be fulfilled.

fulfillmentCenterId.description: The fulfillment center ID where the order item should be fulfilled.

partNumber.description: The reference number that identifies the external part number of the catalog.

UOM.description: The unit of measure of the order item.

contractId.description: The contract ID of the contract on which the order item addition is based.

calculationUsage.description: The identifier for the type of calculation to perform on the order.

calculateOrder.description: Specifies whether OrderCalculateCmd is called to calculate the charges for the order. 0 = do not call OrderCalculateCmd, 1 = call OrderCalculateCmd.

catEntryId.description: The catalog entry ID of the item to delete from the order.

outOrderName.description: Specifies the name-value pairs to add to the redirection URL. The values of the added name-value pairs are the reference numbers of the input orders.

check.description: A list of order items that is to check by the CheckInventory task command.

outReverse.description: List of OrderItems whose allocations should be released.

fromOrderId.description: The orders from which OrderItems is moved.

createIfEmpty.description: The valid value of this parameter is 1 or 0. The default value is 0. If the parameter createIfEmpty is specified to 1 and there is no transferred order items, a new empty order is created when either the toOrderId parameter is ** or the toOrderId parameter is .**. but there is no current pending order. The symbol "**" means to create new pending order; the symbol ".**." means to create new pending order if there are no pending orders currently.

inReverse.description: List of OrderItems whose allocations should be released.

outOrderName.description: The reference number of an output order.

outRemerge.description: List of the OrderItems that should be merged with other OrderItems in the same order and with the same correlationGroup attribute, if possible.

outAllocate.description: List of OrderItems that should be allocated from existing inventory.

inAllocate.description: List of OrderItems that should be allocated from existing inventory.

toOrderId.description: The destination order for the output OrderItems.

moveAutoAddedOrderItems.description: Whether the auto added order items is moved.

inCheck.description: List of OrderItems that should be checked on inventory.

outMerge.description: List of OrderItems that should be merged with other OrderItems in the same order if possible, regardless of their correlationGroup attributes.

inMerge.description: List of OrderItems that should be merged with other OrderItems in the same order if possible, regardless of their correlationGroup attributes.

doInventory.description: Whether the inventory action is performed.

deleteIfEmpty.description: Whether orders should be deleted if no OrderItems remain when the OrderItems are moved.

outBackorder.description: List of OrderItems that should be allocated from expected inventory.

moveOrderPromotionCode.description: Whether the promotion code is merged into the target order.

inOrderName.description: The reference number of an input order.

refreshContractAndOffer.description: Whether the price information for all of the order items is refreshed.

outOrderItemName.description: The reference number of an output OrderItem.

inBackorder.description: List of OrderItems that should be allocated from expected inventory.

outCheck.description: List of OrderItems that should be checked on inventory.

inRemerge.description: List of OrderItems that should be merged with other OrderItems in the same order and with the same correlationGroup attribute, if possible.

contractId.description: The contract ID of the contract on which the order item addition is based.

partNumber.description: The reference number that identifies the external part number of the catalog.

notifyOrderSubmitted.description: Specifies whether the customer is notified when the order is successfully submitted for processing. 1=Yes, 0=No (Default).

SMS.description: Send SMS notifications to the target phone number.

notifyMerchant.description: Whether the store is notified when the order processing is complete. E-mail notifications are only sent when Digital Commerce is configured with Digital Commerce Payments. 1=Yes ,0=No.

notifyShopper.description: Whether the customer is notified when the order processing is complete. E-mail notifications are only sent when Digital Commerce is configured with Digital Commerce Payments. 1=Yes, 0=No.

notify_EMailSender_recipient.description: Send order e-mail notifications to the target recipient.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.order.handler.Cart.description: Request body input for shopping cart submission for checkout.

interval.description: The number of seconds between successive executions of this order.

host.description: Host name responsible for processing an order.

delay.description: The amount of time, in seconds, before order processing is retried, in case of order processing failure. This parameter must be paired with the attempts parameter.

start.description: The time at which the first execution of this order should occur in the format YYYY:MM:DD:hh:mm:ss. Only hh:mm:ss is mandatory.

attempts.description: The number of times the scheduler tries processing this order if order processing fails.

Empty.description: Empty model. Used as default value when no model is specified.

comment.description: The identifier of the address to which the products and items are shipped.

addressId.description: The reference number of the shipping mode to use for the product or item.

catEntryId.description: The identifier of a catalog entry to use to create a new OrderItem.

check.description: A list of OrderItems that should be checked by the CheckInventoryAvailability task command.

UOM.description: The unit of measure for quantity.

ConfigXML.description: The configuration XML of the dynamic kit to add.

inventoryValidation.description: Specifies whether inventory status should be validated for adding to cart.

fulfillmentCenterId.description: The identifier of the fulfillment center that this item belongs to.

shipModeId.description: The identifier associated with a particular shipping service.

contractId.description: The identifier of the contract associated with the order.

physicalStoreId.description: A comment to include with the created or updated order items.

allocate.description: A list of OrderItems that should be allocated from existing inventory.

doPrice.description: Specifies whether the command should perform the price calculation subtasks. Set to enable the price tasks (Y), or to disable price tasks (N).

doInventory.description: Specifies whether the command should perform the inventory calculation subtasks. Set to either do the price tasks (Y), or not (N). Turning off these tasks might result in better performance, but customers might not get the most current inventory level, when changes occur.

calculationUsage.description: The identifier for the type of calculation to perform on the order.

reverse.description: A list of OrderItems whose allocations should be released (that is, de-allocated from existing or expected inventory as appropriate).

remerge.description: A list of the OrderItems that should be merged with other OrderItems in the same order and with the same correlationGroup attribute, if possible. OrderItems are not merged unless their InventoryStatus is "NALC", or they are specified by one or more of the allocate, backorder, and reverse parameters.

calculateOrder.description: Specifies whether OrderCalculateCmd is called to calculate the charges for the order. 0 = do not call OrderCalculateCmd, 1 = call OrderCalculateCmd.

merge.description: A list of OrderItems that should be merged with other OrderItems in the same order if possible, regardless of their correlationGroup attributes.

backorder.description: A list of OrderItems that should be allocated from expected inventory if they are not allocated from existing inventory.

partNumber.description: The part number of catalog entry.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item to add to the order.

ConfigXML.description: The new configuration XML of the dynamic kit.

orderItemId.description: The ID of the order item to update.

comment.description: A comment to include with the item when order items are added to or updated in the destination order.

requestedShipDate.description: The date which the destination order should be shipped.

addressId.description: The reference number of the address to which the order items are shipped.

fromOrderId.description: Specifies zero or more source orders from which order items is copied.

catEntryId.description: The catalog entry ID of the order item.

offerId.description: List of offer IDs to chose from when creating a new order item.

currency.description: The currency of the order items.

pay_paymentname.description: (Deprecated) This is supported for compatibility with earlier versions. With payment rule, ORDPAYINFO is not used, while using payment plugin controller and payment plugins. Sets the payment name-value pairs of the destination order.

copyOrderItemId.description: Specifies which order items should be copied from the source orders specified by fromOrderId and added to the destination order specified by toOrderId.

toOrderId.description: Specifies the order to create or modify.

check.description: List of order items that is to check by the CheckInventory task command.

UOM.description: The unit of measure for the quantity.

prepare.description: Whether to prepare the order by calling the PrepareOrder command.

field2.description: Sets the field2 value of the destination order. If not specified, the corresponding field value of the "orderInfoFrom" order is used, if there is one.

field3.description: Sets the field3 value of the destination order. If not specified, the corresponding field value of the "orderInfoFrom" order is used, if there is one.

field1.description: Sets the field1 value of the destination order. If not specified, the corresponding field value of the "orderInfoFrom" order is used, if there is one.

copyOrderPromotionCode.description: Whether to copy public promotion codes applied to the order.

inventoryValidation.description: Whether inventory status should be validated for adding to cart.

updateOrderItemId.description: Specifies order items in the destination order to update. It is updated using information from other parameters in the enumeration group specified by i, but not from the source orders for that enumeration group and not from catEntryId and partNumber. Note that the catalog entry ID of an order item cannot be updated.

allocate.description: List of order items that is to allocate from existing inventory.

shipModeId.description: The reference number associated with a particular shipping service.

copyOrderUniquePromotionCode.description: Whether to copy unique promotion codes applied to the order.

orderInfoFrom.description: The reference number of an order from which to copy order-level information.

billingAddressId.description: The billing address ID of the destination order.

price.description: The price of the order items.

payInfoFrom.description: The reference number of an order from which to obtain payment information. If more than one order is specified, only the most recently updated of those orders applies.

status.description: The status of the destination order.

shipAsComplete.description: Specifies if the created or modified order can be partially shipped. If the value is Y, the order is shipped when all order items are available. If the value is N, the order can be partially shipped when some of the order items are available.

description.description: The description of the destination order.

copyAutoAddedOrderItems.description: Whether to copy auto-added order items.

shippingModeFromOrderProfile.description: Whether to use the default shipping mode held in the order profile: if the value is 1, the default shipping mode is copied from the order profile to all the order items of the order specified in toOrderId.

configurationId.description: If the order item represents a configured Dynamic Kit, this is the configuration ID.

blockInfoCopy.description: Whether the orderblock objects is copied.

displaySeq.description: The display sequence of the destination order.

partOwnerId.description: The member ID of the part owner, used with partNumber.

copyOrdPayInfo.description: Whether to copy order payment information.

correlationGroup.description: The group to which this order item is related.

contractId.description: The contract reference number associated with the order.

reverse.description: List of order items to release the allocation for.

remerge.description: List of the order items to merge with other order items in the same order and with the same correlationGroup attribute, if possible.

outOrderName.description: The reference number of a destination order.

outOrderItemName.description: The reference number of a destination order item.

isPONumberCopied.description: Whether the PO number of source order is copied to the destination order.

refreshContractAndOffer.description: Whether to refresh the price information for all order items.

memberId.description: The reference number of a member, used to resolve special order abbreviations when they appear in fromOrderId.

merge.description: List of order items that is to merge with other order items in the same order if possible, regardless of their correlationGroup attributes.

sensitiveInfoCopy.description: Whether the payment methods is copied.

continue.description: Controls whether the order copy continues when one or more of the order items cannot be copied. A value of 0 terminates and rolls back execution if an order item cannot be created or updated in the target order. A value of 1 ignores the create or update operation for that order item and continues execution. The default value is 0.

shippingAddressFromOrderProfile.description: Whether to use the default shipping address held in the order profile: if the value is 1, the default shipping address is copied from the order profile to all the order items of the order specified in toOrderId.

backorder.description: List of order items that is to allocate from expected inventory.

partNumber.description: Part number to resolve to a catalog entry. It overrides catEntryId.

tcId.description: The term and condition ID of the destination order.

quantity.description: The quantity of the order item.

x_calculationUsage.description: The identifier for the type of calculation to perform on the order.

x_calculateOrder.description: Specifies whether OrderCalculateCmd is called to calculate the charges for the order. 0 = do not call OrderCalculateCmd, 1 = call OrderCalculateCmd.

x_inventoryValidation.description: Specifies whether inventory status should be validated for adding to cart.

x_validateInventoryForFulfillmentCenter.description: Specifies whether fulfillment center-specific inventory is validated during an update to the cart.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.order.handler.Cart.description: Description of the updateOrderItem input body.
Structure containing an order ID and order item ID.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.order.handler.Assi.description: Body of a request to apply a promotion code to a shopping cart.
Body of a response to apply a coupon to a shopping cart.
Body of a request to apply a coupon to a shopping cart.
Body of a response to remove a promotion code from a shopping cart.
Body of a response to apply a promotion code to a shopping cart.
Body of a response to remove a coupon from a shopping cart.

gettingstarted.content: HCL Commerce REST services support JSON and XML formats for input and output data by default. The default format is JSON. When an XML String is sent to a REST service, you must set Content-Type HTTP header to be "application/xml". The REST service converts the XML input data to the JSON format that is accepted by REST services. Therefore, your input XML format must follow a certain structure so that it can be transformed to the JSON object that is accepted by REST services. See more here:
gettingstarted.name: Response formats

gettingstarted.content: Preview tokens are encrypted strings that encapsulates a set of preview options and restrictions on when and where the token can be used. Any user who is authorized to access your server and has a preview token, can complete preview actions in the same store for which that token is generated. See more here:
gettingstarted.name: Preview tokens

gettingstarted.content: Some HCL Commerce REST services require a request to be sent over HTTPS. Learn more here:
gettingstarted.name: Secure Sockets Layer
